info.title: Occurrence API
info.description:
This API works against the GBIF Occurrence Store, which handles occurrence records and makes them available through the web service and download files.
Internally we use a [Java web service client](https://github.com/gbif/occurrence/tree/master/occurrence-ws-client) for the consumption of these HTTP-based, RESTful web services.

tags.name: Occurrences
tags.description: This API provides services related to the retrieval of single occurrence records.

tags.name: Searching occurrences
tags.description:
This API provides services for searching occurrence records that have been indexed by GBIF.

In order to retrieve all results for a given search filter you need to issue individual requests for each page, which is limited to a maximum size of 300 records per page. Note that for technical reasons we also have a hard limit for any query of 100,000 records. You will get an error if the offset + limit exceeds 100,000. To retrieve all records beyond 100,000 you should use our asynchronous download service (below) instead.

tags.name: Occurrence downloads
tags.description:
**For a guide to making downloads through the API, see the [guide to API downloads](/en/data-use/api-downloads).** *The documentation here is automatically generated from the Java code.  It is always up-to-date, but the structure for the main download request method is complex.*

This API provides services to request bulk downloads of occurrence records and retrieve information about those downloads.

Occurrence downloads are created asynchronously — the user requests a download and, once complete, is sent an email with a link to the resulting file.

It is necessary to register as a user at [GBIF.org](https://www.gbif.org/) to create a download request, and use HTTP authentication using the username (not the email) and password.

### Occurrence Download Predicates

For the API reference for download predicates expand the “Schema” → `predicate` section of the request body schema on the [creation API call](#Occurrence%20downloads/requestDownload) (the first one after this text).

### Occurrence Download Limits

Occurrence downloads demand significant computational resources, and are monitored and limited according to the GBIF platform load. In order to avoid that downloads requested by a single user utilize most of the resources two rules have been set:

1. Download complexity limits:
   * A download predicate may contain a maximum of 101,000 items (taxon keys, kingdom keys, phylum keys,      catalogue numbers, occurrence ids and so on).
   * A download predicate may contain a maximum of 10,000 points in any “within” predicate geometries.
2. Limits on incomplete (preparing, running) downloads:
   * If the total number of incomplete downloads is fewer than 100, any single user can have no more than 3      incomplete downloads.
   * If the total number of downloads is fewer than 1000 any single user may only have 1 download.

The number of user downloads currently in progress can be seen on the [System Health page](https://www.gbif.org/system-health). Your own downloads can be seen on your [My Downloads](https://www.gbif.org/user/download) page.

tags.name: Occurrence download formats
tags.description: This API lists the fields present in the various download formats, their data types and their term identifiers.

tags.name: Occurrence download statistics
tags.description: This API provides statistics about occurrence downloads.

tags.name: Occurrence metrics
tags.description: This API provides services to retrieve various counts and metrics provided for occurrence records. The metrics that are currently supported are listed by the API itself, see [the schema method](#operation/getOccurrenceCountSchema) for details.

tags.name: Occurrence inventories
tags.description: This API provides services that list all distinct values together with their occurrence count for a given occurrence property. Only a few properties are supported, each with its own service to call.

tags.name: GADM regions
tags.description:
The [GADM Global Administrative Area Database](https://gadm.org) is a high-resolution database of administrative areas of countries.

Within GBIF, it is used to index occurrence data by administrative region.

This API provides services to search and browse regions and sub-regions down to the third level sub-region.

get.description: Full search across all occurrences.

parameters.name: acceptedTaxonKey
parameters.description: A taxon key from the GBIF backbone or the specified checklist (see checklistKey parameter). Only synonym taxa are included in the search, so a search for Aves with acceptedTaxonKey=212 (i.e. [/occurrence/search?taxonKey=212](https://api.gbif.org/v1/occurrence/search?acceptedTaxonKey=212)) will match occurrences identified as birds, but not any known family, genus or species of bird.*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: associatedSequences
parameters.description:
Identifier (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the material entity.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: basisOfRecord
parameters.description:
Basis of record, as defined in our BasisOfRecord vocabulary.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

items.description:
The values of the Darwin Core term Basis of Record which can apply to occurrences.

See GBIF's [Darwin Core Type Vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/dwc/basis_of_record.xml) for definitions.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: bed
parameters.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the material entity was collected.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: catalogNumber
parameters.description:
An identifier of any form assigned by the source within a physical collection or digital dataset for the record which may not be unique, but should be fairly unique in combination with the institution and collection code.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: classKey
parameters.description:
Class classification key.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: checklistKey
parameters.description: *Experimental.* The checklist key. This determines which taxonomy will be used for the search in conjunction with other taxon keys or scientificName. If this is not specified, the GBIF backbone taxonomy will be used.

parameters.name: collectionCode
parameters.description:
An identifier of any form assigned by the source to identify the physical collection or digital dataset uniquely within the context of an institution.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: collectionKey
parameters.description:
A key (UUID) for a collection registered in the [Global Registry of Scientific Collections](https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: continent
parameters.description:
Continent, as defined in our Continent vocabulary.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

items.description:
The continent, based on a 7 continent model described on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number_of_continents) and the [World Geographical Scheme for Recording Plant Distributions (WGSRPD)](https://www.tdwg.org/standards/109).

In particular this splits the Americas into North and South America with North America including the Caribbean (except Trinidad and Tobago) and reaching down and including Panama.

See the [GBIF Continents](https://github.com/gbif/continents/) for the exact divisions.

*This is a geographical division.  See `GBIFRegion` for GBIF's political divisions.*

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
parameters.description:
The horizontal distance (in metres) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location.

*Supports range queries.*

parameters.name: country
parameters.description:
The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country in which the occurrence was recorded.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: crawlId
parameters.description:
Crawl attempt that harvested this record.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: datasetId
parameters.description:
The ID of the dataset.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: datasetKey
parameters.description:
The occurrence dataset key (a UUID).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: datasetName
parameters.description:
The exact name of the dataset.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: day
parameters.description:
The day of the month, a number between 1 and 31.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: decimalLatitude
parameters.description:
Latitude in decimal degrees between -90° and 90° based on WGS 84.

*Supports range queries.*

parameters.name: degreeOfEstablishment
parameters.description:
The degree to which an organism survives, reproduces and expands its range at the given place and time, as defined in the [GBIF DegreeOfEstablishment vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/DegreeOfEstablishment/concepts).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: decimalLongitude
parameters.description:
Longitude in decimals between -180 and 180 based on WGS 84.

*Supports range queries.*

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description:
Depth in metres relative to altitude. For example 10 metres below a lake surface with given altitude.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: distanceFromCentroidInMeters
parameters.description:
The horizontal distance (in metres) of the occurrence from the nearest centroid known to be used in automated georeferencing procedures, if that distance is 5000m or less.  Occurrences (especially specimens) near a country centroid may have a poor-quality georeference, especially if coordinateUncertaintyInMeters is blank or large.

*Supports range queries.*

parameters.name: dwcaExtension
parameters.description:
A known Darwin Core Archive extension RowType.  Limits the search to occurrences which have this extension, although they will not necessarily have any useful data recorded using the extension.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: earliestEonOrLowestEonothem
parameters.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: earliestEraOrLowestErathem
parameters.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem
parameters.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: earliestEpochOrLowestSeries
parameters.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: earliestAgeOrLowestStage
parameters.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: elevation
parameters.description:
Elevation (altitude) in metres above sea level.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: endDayOfYear
parameters.description:
The latest integer day of the year on which the event occurred.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: establishmentMeans
parameters.description:
Whether an organism or organisms have been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans, as defined in the [GBIF EstablishmentMeans vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/EstablishmentMeans/concepts).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: eventDate
parameters.description:
Occurrence date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy, yyyy-MM or yyyy-MM-dd.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description:
An identifier for the information associated with a sampling event.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: familyKey
parameters.description: Family classification key.

parameters.name: fieldNumber
parameters.description:
An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the event.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: formation
parameters.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the material entity was collected.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: gadmGid
parameters.description:
A GADM geographic identifier at any level, for example AGO, AGO.1_1, AGO.1.1_1 or AGO.1.1.1_1

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: gadmLevel0Gid
parameters.description:
A GADM geographic identifier at the zero level, for example AGO.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: gadmLevel1Gid
parameters.description:
A GADM geographic identifier at the first level, for example AGO.1_1.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: gadmLevel2Gid
parameters.description:
A GADM geographic identifier at the second level, for example AFG.1.1_1.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: gadmLevel3Gid
parameters.description:
A GADM geographic identifier at the third level, for example AFG.1.1.1_1.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: gbifId
parameters.description: The unique GBIF key for a single occurrence.

parameters.name: gbifRegion
parameters.description:
Gbif region based on country code.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

items.description:
An enumeration for all GBIF Regions. These are based on [IPBES regions](https://www.nature.com/articles/sdata20167/figures/1).

*This is a political division,* part of GBIF's governance structure.

parameters.name: genusKey
parameters.description: Genus classification key.

parameters.name: geoDistance
parameters.description:
Filters to match occurrence records with coordinate values within a specified distance of a coordinate.

Distance may be specified in kilometres (km) or metres (m).

parameters.name: georeferencedBy
parameters.description:
Name of a person, group, or organization who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the location.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description:
Searches for occurrences inside a polygon described in Well Known Text (WKT) format. Only `POLYGON` and `MULTIPOLYGON` are accepted WKT types.

For example, a shape written as `POLYGON ((30.1 10.1, 40 40, 20 40, 10 20, 30.1 10.1))` would be queried as is.

_Polygons must have *anticlockwise* ordering of points._ (A clockwise polygon represents the opposite area: the Earth's surface with a 'hole' in it. Such queries are not supported.)

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: group
parameters.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the material entity was collected.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: hasCoordinate
parameters.description: Limits searches to occurrence records which contain a value in both latitude and longitude (i.e. `hasCoordinate=true` limits to occurrence records with coordinate values and `hasCoordinate=false` limits to occurrence records without coordinate values).

parameters.name: higherGeography
parameters.description:
Geographic name less specific than the information captured in the locality term.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: highestBiostratigraphicZone
parameters.description:
The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: hasGeospatialIssue
parameters.description:
Includes/excludes occurrence records which contain spatial issues (as determined in our record interpretation), i.e. hasGeospatialIssue=true returns only those records with spatial issues while hasGeospatialIssue=false includes only records without spatial issues.

The absence of this parameter returns any record with or without spatial issues.

parameters.name: hostingOrganizationKey
parameters.description:
The key (UUID) of the publishing organization whose installation (server) hosts the original dataset.

(This is of little interest to most data users.)

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: identifiedBy
parameters.description:
The person who provided the taxonomic identification of the occurrence.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: identifiedByID
parameters.description:
Identifier (e.g. ORCID) for the person who provided the taxonomic identification of the occurrence.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: installationKey
parameters.description:
The occurrence installation key (a UUID).

(This is of little interest to most data users.  It is the identifier for the server that provided the data to GBIF.)

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: institutionCode
parameters.description:
An identifier of any form assigned by the source to identify the institution the record belongs to. Not guaranteed to be unique.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: institutionKey
parameters.description:
A key (UUID) for an institution registered in the [Global Registry of Scientific Collections](https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: issue
parameters.description:
A specific interpretation issue as defined in our OccurrenceIssue enumeration.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: isInCluster
parameters.description: *Experimental.* Searches for records which are part of a cluster.  See the documentation on [clustering](/en/data-processing/clustering-occurrences).

parameters.name: island
parameters.description:
The name of the island on or near which the location occurs.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: islandGroup
parameters.description:
The name of the island group in which the location occurs.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: isSequenced
parameters.description: Flag occurrence when associated sequences exists

parameters.name: iucnRedListCategory
parameters.description:
A threat status category from the IUCN Red List.  The two-letter code for the status should be used.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: kingdomKey
parameters.description:
Kingdom classification key.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: lastInterpreted
parameters.description:
This date the record was last modified in GBIF, in ISO 8601 format: yyyy, yyyy-MM, yyyy-MM-dd, or MM-dd.

Note that this is the date the record was last changed in GBIF, not necessarily the date the record was first/last changed by the publisher. Data is re-interpreted when we change the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources, or interpretation processes.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: latestEonOrHighestEonothem
parameters.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: latestEraOrHighestErathem
parameters.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: latestPeriodOrHighestSystem
parameters.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: latestEpochOrHighestSeries
parameters.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: latestAgeOrHighestStage
parameters.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected.*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: license
parameters.description:
The licence applied to the dataset or record by the publisher.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: lifeStage
parameters.description:
The age class or life stage of an organism at the time the occurrence was recorded, as defined in the GBIF LifeStage vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/LifeStage/concepts).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: locality
parameters.description:
The specific description of the place.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: lowestBiostratigraphicZone
parameters.description:
The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the material entity was collected.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.description:
The kind of multimedia associated with an occurrence as defined in our MediaType enumeration.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: member
parameters.description:
The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the material entity was collected.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: modified
parameters.description:
The most recent date-time on which the occurrnce was changed, according to the publisher.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: month
parameters.description:
The month of the year, starting with 1 for January.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: networkKey
parameters.description:
The network's GBIF key (a UUID).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: occurrenceId
parameters.description:
A globally unique identifier for the occurrence record as provided by the publisher.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: occurrenceStatus
parameters.description: Either `ABSENT` or `PRESENT`; the presence or absence of the occurrence.

schema.description:
A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location.

For definitions, see the [GBIF occurrence status vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/gbif/occurrence_status/).

parameters.name: orderKey
parameters.description:
Order classification key.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: organismId
parameters.description:
An identifier for the organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: organismQuantity
parameters.description:
A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: organismQuantityType
parameters.description:
The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

*Note this term is not aligned to a vocabulary.*

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: otherCatalogNumbers
parameters.description:
Previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: parentEventId
parameters.description:
An identifier for the information associated with a sampling event.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: pathway
parameters.description:
The process by which an organism came to be in a given place at a given time, as defined in the [GBIF Pathway vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/Pathway/concepts).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: phylumKey
parameters.description:
Phylum classification key.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: preparations
parameters.description:
Preparation or preservation method for a specimen.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: previousIdentifications
parameters.description:
Previous assignment of name to the organism.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: programme
parameters.description:
A group of activities, often associated with a specific funding stream, such as the GBIF BID programme.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description:
The identifier for a project, which is often assigned by a funded programme.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description:
Protocol or mechanism used to provide the occurrence record.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: publishingCountry
parameters.description:
The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the owning organization's country.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: publishedByGbifRegion
parameters.description:
GBIF region based on the owning organization's country.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

items.description:
An enumeration for all GBIF Regions. These are based on [IPBES regions](https://www.nature.com/articles/sdata20167/figures/1).

*This is a political division,* part of GBIF's governance structure.

parameters.name: publishingOrg
parameters.description:
The publishing organization's GBIF key (a UUID).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: recordedBy
parameters.description:
The person who recorded the occurrence.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: recordedByID
parameters.description:
Identifier (e.g. ORCID) for the person who recorded the occurrence.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: recordNumber
parameters.description:
An identifier given to the record at the time it was recorded in the field.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: relativeOrganismQuantity
parameters.description:
The relative measurement of the quantity of the organism (i.e. without absolute units).

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: repatriated
parameters.description: Searches for records whose publishing country is different to the country in which the record was recorded.

parameters.name: sampleSizeUnit
parameters.description:
The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: sampleSizeValue
parameters.description:
A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: samplingProtocol
parameters.description:
The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during a sampling event.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: sex
parameters.description:
The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the occurrence.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: scientificName
parameters.description:
A scientific name from the [GBIF backbone](https://www.gbif.org/dataset/d7dddbf4-2cf0-4f39-9b2a-bb099caae36c) or the specified checklist (see checklistKey parameter). All included and synonym taxa are included in the search.

Under the hood a call to the [species match service](https://www.gbif.org/developer/species#searching) is done first to retrieve a taxonKey. Only unique scientific names will return results, homonyms (many monomials) return nothing! Consider to use the taxonKey parameter instead and the species match service directly.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: speciesKey
parameters.description: Species classification key.*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: startDayOfYear
parameters.description:
The earliest integer day of the year on which the event occurred.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: stateProvince
parameters.description:
The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

This term does not have any data quality checks; see also the GADM parameters.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: taxonConceptId
parameters.description:
An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: taxonKey
parameters.description: A taxon key from the GBIF backbone or the specified checklist (see checklistKey parameter). All included (child) and synonym taxa are included in the search, so a search for Aves with taxonKey=212 (i.e. [/occurrence/search?taxonKey=212](https://api.gbif.org/v1/occurrence/search?taxonKey=212)) will match all birds, no matter which species.*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: taxonId
parameters.description:
The taxon identifier provided to GBIF by the data publisher.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: taxonomicIssue
parameters.description:
*Experimental.* A specific taxonomic interpretation issue as defined in our OccurrenceIssue enumeration.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: taxonomicStatus
parameters.description:
A taxonomic status from our TaxonomicStatus enumeration.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: typeStatus
parameters.description:
Nomenclatural type (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: verbatimScientificName
parameters.description:
The scientific name provided to GBIF by the data publisher, before interpretation and processing by GBIF.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: waterBody
parameters.description:
The name of the water body in which the Locations occurs.

*Parameter may be repeated.*

parameters.name: year
parameters.description:
The 4 digit year. A year of 98 will be interpreted as AD 98.

*Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: geologicalTime
parameters.description: The geological time of an occurrence that is present in the chronostratigraphy terms. *Parameter may be repeated or a range.*

parameters.name: lithostratigraphy
parameters.description: The lithostratigraphy of an occurrence that is present in the group, formation, member and bed terms

parameters.name: biostratigraphy
parameters.description: The biostratigraphy of an occurrence that is present in the lowest and highest biostratigraphy terms

parameters.name: matchCase
parameters.description: *Experimental.* Indicates if the search has to be case sensitive

parameters.name: shuffle
parameters.description: *Experimental.* Seed to sort the results randomly.

parameters.name: hl
parameters.description:
Set `hl=true` to highlight terms matching the query when in full-text search fields. The highlight will be an emphasis tag of class `gbifH1` e.g. [`/search?q=plant&hl=true`](https://api.gbif.org/v1/literature/search?q=plant&hl=true).

Full-text search fields include: title, keyword, country, publishing country, publishing organization title, hosting organization title, and description. One additional full text field is searched which includes information from metadata documents, but the text of this field is not returned in the response.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Simple full-text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the maximum threshold, which is 300 for this service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. This service has a maximum offset of 100,000.

parameters.name: facet
parameters.description:
A facet name used to retrieve the most frequent values for a field. Facets are allowed for all search parameters except geometry and geoDistance. This parameter may by repeated to request multiple facets, as in [this example](https://api.gbif.org/v1/occurrence/search?facet=datasetKey&facet=basisOfRecord&limit=0).

Note terms not available for searching are not available for faceting.

parameters.name: facetMincount

get.summary: Lists all downloads from a user
get.description: Retrieves the status, definitions and locations of all occurrence download by your own user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Username (administrator account required to see other users).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: List of statuses to filter by.

schema.description:
The status of the download.

* `PREPARING`: the download is in a queue, waiting for other downloads to complete
* `RUNNING`: the download is being processed
* `SUCCEEDED`: the download has completed and the file is ready to be downloaded
* `CANCELLED`: the download was cancelled by the user
* `KILLED`: the download was killed by the download engine
* `FAILED`: the download failed
* `SUSPENDED`: the download was paused and its execution will be resumed later
* `FILE_ERASED`: the download was successful, but the download file [has since been deleted](https://www.gbif.org/faq?question=for-how-long-will-does-gbif-store-downloads).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date time in ISO format to filter downloads by its creation date.

parameters.name: statistics
parameters.description: If true it returns the counts of datasets, organizations and countries. By default it's true to maintain backwards compatibility.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

ConjunctionPredicate.description: A logical conjunction (“AND”) of a list of sub-predicates

predicates.description: The list of sub-predicates to combine

DisjunctionPredicate.description: A logical disjunction (“OR”) of a list of sub-predicates

EqualsPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is equal to its `value`.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

FullTextSearchPredicate.description:
This predicate performs a full-text search based on a query parameter.

This predicate type is not currently supported for occurrence downloads.

GeoDistancePredicate.description: This predicate checks if an occurrence falls within a distance of a location.

distance.description: The distance as a number and unit, e.g. `5km` or `5000m`.

GreaterThanOrEqualsPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is greater than or equal to to its `value`.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

GreaterThanPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is greater than to its `value`.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

InPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is equal to any of its `values`.

values.description: The list of value to test for.

items.description: The list of value to test for.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

IsNotNullPredicate.description: This predicate checks if the `parameter` is not null (empty).

IsNullPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `parameter` is null (empty).

LessThanOrEqualsPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is less than or equal to to its `value`.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

LessThanPredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is less than to its `value`.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

LikePredicate.description:
This predicate checks if its `key` matches a simple pattern in the `value`.

The character `?` matches a single character, and `*` matches zero or more characters.
This is similar to the matching used by ElasticSearch, Unix/DOS shells, etc.

matchCase.description: Whether to match letter case (UPPER or lower case) on string value comparisons.

Predicate.description: A predicate defining filters to apply for the download.

RangePredicate.description: This predicate checks if its `key` is within the range `value`.

RangeValue.description: The range value to test for.

WithinPredicate.description: This predicate checks if an occurrence falls within the given WKT geometry.

geometry.description: The WKT geometry to test for.  Occurrences whose location is within this geometry are returned.

AgentIdentifier.description: A list of the globally unique identifiers for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for assigning the Taxon to the occurrence.

Classification.description: The map of classifications associated with this occurrence keyed by checklistKey.

FacetOccurrenceSearchParameter.description:
The resulting facets of a search operation.  The list can be empty if no facets were requested.

If there are no values for a facet, it will not be included in the list, i.e.: a facet should have at least 1 occurrence.

Gadm.description:
The administrative divisions according to the [GADM database](https://gadm.org/).

This value is applied by GBIF's processing without consideration of the `stateProvince`, `county` or `locality` fields.

gid.description: The identifier in GADM for the administrative division.

name.description: The English name in GADM for the administrative division.

GadmFeature.description: A region from the GADM database.

identifier.description: Other known identifier used for the same taxon. Can be a URL pointing to a webpage, an XML or RDF document, a DOI UUID or any other identifier.

title.description: The optional title of an identifier, mostly for linking.

identifierLink.description: An HTTP link for an identifier, if a suitable, known resolver exists for the identifier type.

IsoDateInterval.description: The date-time during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context.

MeasurementOrFact.description: Measurements or facts about the the occurrence.

format.description: The format the image is exposed in.

references.description: An HTML webpage that shows the image or its metadata.

description.description: A longer description for this media item.

audience.description: A class or description for whom the image is intended or useful.

created.description: The date and time this media item was created.

creator.description: The person that created the media item.

contributor.description: Any contributor in addition to the creator that helped in recording the media item.

publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the media item available.

rightsHolder.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the media item.

identifier.description: The public URL that identifies and locates the media item.

key.description:
Unique GBIF key for the occurrence.

We aim to keep these keys stable, but this is not possible in every case.

datasetKey.description: The UUID of the GBIF dataset containing this occurrence.

publishingOrgKey.description: The UUID of the organization which publishes the dataset containing this occurrence.

networkKeys.description: Any networks to which the dataset containing this occurrence is registered.

items.description: Any networks to which the dataset containing this occurrence is registered.

installationKey.description: The UUID of the technical installation hosted the dataset containing this occurrence.

hostingOrganizationKey.description: The UUID of the publishing organization which operates the technical installation hosting the dataset containing this occurrence.

publishingCountry.description: The country, territory or island based on ISO-3166 of the organization publishing the dataset containing this occurrence.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

protocol.description: The technical protocol by which this occurrence was retrieved from the publisher's systems.

lastCrawled.description: The time this occurrence was last retrieved from the publisher's systems.

lastParsed.description:
The time this occurrence was last processed by GBIF's interpretation system “Pipelines”.

This is the time the record was last changed in GBIF, **not** the time the record was last changed by the publisher.  Data is also reprocessed when we changed the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources or other interpretation procedures.

An earlier interpretation system distinguished between “parsing” and “interpretation”, but in the current system there is only one process — the two dates will always be the same.

crawlId.description: The sequence number of the attempt by GBIF to download (”crawl”), interpret and index the dataset to which this occurrence belongs.

projectId.description: The identifier for a project, often assigned by a funded programme.

programmeAcronym.description: The identifier for a programme which funded the digitization of this occurrence.

additionalProperties.description:
The verbatim Darwin Core Archive extension fields for this occurrence.

The main key is the record class term (the row type in Darwin Core Archive), within that are  values with extension terms as keys.

basisOfRecord.description:
The values of the Darwin Core term Basis of Record which can apply to occurrences.

See GBIF's [Darwin Core Type Vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/dwc/basis_of_record.xml) for definitions.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

individualCount.description: The number of individuals present at the time of the Occurrence.

occurrenceStatus.description:
A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location.

For definitions, see the [GBIF occurrence status vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/gbif/occurrence_status/).

lifeStage.description:
The age class or life stage of the Organism(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF LifeStage vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/LifeStage/concepts)

establishmentMeans.description:
Statement about whether an organism or organisms have been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF EstablishmentMeans vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/EstablishmentMeans/concepts),which is derived from the [Darwin Core EstablishmentMeans vocabulary](https://dwc.tdwg.org/em/).

degreeOfEstablishment.description:
The degree to which an Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF DegreeOfEstablishment vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/DegreeOfEstablishment/concepts),which is derived from the [Darwin Core DegreeOfEstablishment vocabulary](https://dwc.tdwg.org/doe/).

pathway.description:
The process by which an Organism came to be in a given place at a given time.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF Pathway vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/Pathway/concepts),which is derived from the [Darwin Core Pathway vocabulary](https://dwc.tdwg.org/pw/).

classifications.description: The map of classifications associated with this occurrence keyed by checklistKey.

taxonKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the most specific (lowest rank) taxon for this occurrence.  This could be a synonym, see `acceptedTaxonKey`.

kingdomKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the kingdom of thisoccurrence.

phylumKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the phylum of thisoccurrence.

classKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the class of thisoccurrence.

orderKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the order of thisoccurrence.

familyKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the family of thisoccurrence.

genusKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the genus of thisoccurrence.

subgenusKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the subgenus of thisoccurrence.

speciesKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the species of thisoccurrence.

acceptedTaxonKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the accepted taxon of this occurrence.

scientificName.description: The scientific name (including authorship) for the taxon from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.  This could be a synonym, see also `acceptedScientificName`.

scientificNameAuthorship.description: The scientific name authorship for the taxon from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.  This could be a synonym, see also `acceptedScientificName`.

acceptedScientificName.description: The accepted scientific name (including authorship) for the taxon from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

kingdom.description: The kingdom name (excluding authorship) for the kingdom from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

phylum.description: The phylum name (excluding authorship) for the phylum from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

order.description: The order name (excluding authorship) for the order from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

family.description: The family name (excluding authorship) for the family from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

genus.description: The genus name (excluding authorship) for the genus from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

subgenus.description: The subgenus name (excluding authorship) for the subgenus from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

species.description: The species name (excluding authorship) for the species from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

genericName.description: The genus name part of the species name from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

specificEpithet.description: The specific name part of the species name from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

infraspecificEpithet.description: The infraspecific name part of the species name from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

taxonRank.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName.

taxonomicStatus.description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon.

iucnRedListCategory.description:
The IUCN Red List Category of the taxon of this occurrence.

See the [GBIF vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/iucn/threat_status/) for the values and their definitions, and the [IUCN Red List of Threatened Species dataset in GBIF](https://doi.org/10.15468/0qnb58) for the version of the Red List GBIF's interpretation procedures are using.

dateIdentified.description: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the Taxon.

decimalLatitude.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the WGS84 datum) of the geographic centre of the location of the occurrence.

decimalLongitude.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the WGS84 datum) of the geographic centre of the location of the occurrence.

coordinatePrecision.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

coordinateUncertaintyInMeters.description: The horizontal distance (in metres) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location.

coordinateAccuracy.description: **Deprecated.**  This value is always null.  It is an obsolete Darwin Core term.

elevation.description: Elevation (altitude) in metres above sea level.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

elevationAccuracy.description: The value of the potential error associated with the elevation.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

depth.description: Depth in metres below sea level.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

depthAccuracy.description: The value of the potential error associated with the depth.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

continent.description:
The continent, based on a 7 continent model described on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number_of_continents) and the [World Geographical Scheme for Recording Plant Distributions (WGSRPD)](https://www.tdwg.org/standards/109).

In particular this splits the Americas into North and South America with North America including the Caribbean (except Trinidad and Tobago) and reaching down and including Panama.

See the [GBIF Continents](https://github.com/gbif/continents/) for the exact divisions.

*This is a geographical division.  See `GBIFRegion` for GBIF's political divisions.*

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

stateProvince.description:
The name of the next-smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the occurrence occurs.

This value is unaltered by GBIF's processing; see also the GADM fields.

waterBody.description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs.

distanceFromCentroidInMeters.description: The distance in metres of the occurrence from a centroid known to be applied to occurrences during georeferencing.  This can potentially indicate low-precision georeferencing, check the values of `coordinateUncertaintyInMeters` and `georeferenceRemarks`.

higherGeography.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the dwc:locality term.

georeferencedBy.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the dcterms:Location.

year.description: The four-digit year in which the event occurred, according to the Common Era calendar.

month.description: The integer month in which the Event occurred.

day.description: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

startDayOfYear.description: The latest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for 1 January, 365 for 31 December, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

endDayOfYear.description: The earliest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for 1 January, 365 for 31 December, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

typeStatus.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the occurrence.

typifiedName.description:
The scientific name that is based on the type specimen.

This is not yet a Darwin Core term, see the [proposal to add it](https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/28).

issues.description:
A specific interpretation issue found during processing and interpretation of the record.

See the https://links.gbif.org/occurrence-issues[list of occurrence issues] and the https://gbif.github.io/gbif-api/apidocs/org/gbif/api/vocabulary/OccurrenceIssue.html[OccurrenceIssue enumeration] for possible values and definitions.

items.description:
A specific interpretation issue found during processing and interpretation of the record.

See the https://links.gbif.org/occurrence-issues[list of occurrence issues] and the https://gbif.github.io/gbif-api/apidocs/org/gbif/api/vocabulary/OccurrenceIssue.html[OccurrenceIssue enumeration] for possible values and definitions.

modified.description: The most recent date-time on which the occurrence was changed, according to the publisher.

lastInterpreted.description:
The time this occurrence was last processed by GBIF's interpretation system “Pipelines”.

This is the time the record was last changed in GBIF, **not** the time the record was last changed by the publisher.  Data is also reprocessed when we changed the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources or other interpretation procedures.

An earlier interpretation system distinguished between “parsing” and “interpretation”, but in the current system there is only one process — the two dates will always be the same.

references.description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.

license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the occurrence.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

organismQuantity.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

organismQuantityType.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

sampleSizeUnit.description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

sampleSizeValue.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

relativeOrganismQuantity.description: The relative measurement of the quantity of the organism (i.e. without absolute units).

associatedSequences.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the material entity.

facts.description: Measurements or facts about the the occurrence.

institutionKey.description: **Experimental.**  The UUID of the institution holding the specimen occurrence, from GRSciColl.

collectionKey.description: **Experimental.**  The UUID of the collection containing the specimen occurrence, from GRSciColl.

isInCluster.description: **Experimental.**  Whether the occurrence belongs to a machine-calculated cluster of probable duplicate occurrences.

datasetID.description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

datasetName.description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

otherCatalogNumbers.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalogue numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

earliestEonOrLowestEonothem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestEonOrHighestEonothem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestEraOrLowestErathem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestEraOrHighestErathem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestPeriodOrHighestSystem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestEpochOrHighestSeries.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestAgeOrLowestStage.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestAgeOrHighestStage.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

lowestBiostratigraphicZone.description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

highestBiostratigraphicZone.description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

group.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

formation.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

member.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

bed.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

recordedBy.description: A person, group, or organization responsible for recording the original occurrence.

identifiedBy.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the occurrence.

preparations.description: A preparation or preservation method for a specimen.

samplingProtocol.description: The methods or protocols used during an Event, denoted by an IRI.

dnaSequenceID.description: **Experimental.**  The DNA sequence ID of an occurrence.

items.description: **Experimental.**  The DNA sequence ID of an occurrence.

geodeticDatum.description:
The geodetic datum for the interpreted decimal coordinates.

Coordinates are reprojected to WGS84 if they exist, so this field is either null or `WGS84`.

class.description: The class name (excluding authorship) for the class from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

countryCode.description: The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country, territory or area in which the occurrence was recorded.

recordedByIDs.description: A list of the globally unique identifiers for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence.

identifiedByIDs.description: A list of the globally unique identifiers for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for assigning the Taxon to the occurrence.

status.description:
The status of the download.

* `PREPARING`: the download is in a queue, waiting for other downloads to complete
* `RUNNING`: the download is being processed
* `SUCCEEDED`: the download has completed and the file is ready to be downloaded
* `CANCELLED`: the download was cancelled by the user
* `KILLED`: the download was killed by the download engine
* `FAILED`: the download failed
* `SUSPENDED`: the download was paused and its execution will be resumed later
* `FILE_ERASED`: the download was successful, but the download file [has since been deleted](https://www.gbif.org/faq?question=for-how-long-will-does-gbif-store-downloads).

downloadLink.description: A link to download the data, if the status is `SUCCEEDED`.

size.description: The size, in bytes, of the download data.

totalRecords.description: The total number of occurrence records included in the download.

numberDatasets.description: The total number of datasets from which occurrence records were drawn.

numberOrganizations.description: The total number of organizations from which occurrence records were drawn.

numberPublishingCountries.description: The total number of publishing countries from which occurrence records were drawn.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

offset.description:
The offset of the results within all the search results.

Subsequent pages can be retrieved by using `offset + count` as the new offset.

limit.description: The limit used.  Note the limit returned may be lower than the limit requested.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.
